message.content: you are a terminal/shell poweruser.  My current prompt is too busy and confusing.  Please review and fix the shell prompt.  Currently we are using oh my zsh, however if you (as a shell poweruser) considers that's not best, you can remove and uninstall it.

content.text: I'll help you clean up your shell prompt. Let me first examine your current setup and then provide a cleaner, more efficient solution.

1â†’# Enable Powerlevel10k instant prompt. Should stay close to the top of ~/.zshrc.
     2â†’# Initialization code that may require console input (password prompts, [y/n]
     3â†’# confirmations, etc.) must go above this block; everything else may go below.
     4â†’if [[ -r "${XDG_CACHE_HOME:-$HOME/.cache}/p10k-instant-prompt-${(%):-%n}.zsh" ]]; then
     5â†’  source "${XDG_CACHE_HOME:-$HOME/.cache}/p10k-instant-prompt-${(%):-%n}.zsh"
     6â†’fi
     7â†’
     8â†’# If you come from bash you might have to change your $PATH.
     9â†’# export PATH=$HOME/bin:$HOME/.local/bin:/usr/local/bin:$PATH
    10â†’
    11â†’# Path to your Oh My Zsh installation.
    12â†’export ZSH="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh"
    13â†’
    14â†’# Claude Code TTS Configuration
    15â†’# API keys moved to ~/.env for security
    16â†’
    17â†’# Set name of the theme to load --- if set to "random", it will
    18â†’# load a random theme each time Oh My Zsh is loaded, in which case,
    19â†’# to know which specific one was loaded, run: echo $RANDOM_THEME
    20â†’# See https://github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/wiki/Themes
    21â†’ZSH_THEME="robbyrussell"
    22â†’
    23â†’# Set list of themes to pick from when loading at random
    24â†’# Setting this variable when ZSH_THEME=random will cause zsh to load
    25â†’# a theme from this variable instead of looking in $ZSH/themes/
    26â†’# If set to an empty array, this variable will have no effect.
    27â†’# ZSH_THEME_RANDOM_CANDIDATES=( "robbyrussell" "agnoster" )
    28â†’
    29â†’# Uncomment the following line to use case-sensitive completion.
    30â†’# CASE_SENSITIVE="true"
    31â†’
    32â†’# Uncomment the following line to use hyphen-insensitive completion.
    33â†’# Case-sensitive completion must be off. _ and - will be interchangeable.
    34â†’# HYPHEN_INSENSITIVE="true"
    35â†’
    36â†’# Uncomment one of the following lines to change the auto-update behavior
    37â†’# zstyle ':omz:update' mode disabled  # disable automatic updates
    38â†’# zstyle ':omz:update' mode auto      # update automatically without asking
    39â†’# zstyle ':omz:update' mode reminder  # just remind me to update when it's time
    40â†’
    41â†’# Uncomment the following line to change how often to auto-update (in days).
    42â†’# zstyle ':omz:update' frequency 13
    43â†’
    44â†’# Uncomment the following line if pasting URLs and other text is messed up.
    45â†’# DISABLE_MAGIC_FUNCTIONS="true"
    46â†’
    47â†’# Uncomment the following line to disable colors in ls.
    48â†’# DISABLE_LS_COLORS="true"
    49â†’
    50â†’# Uncomment the following line to disable auto-setting terminal title.
    51â†’# DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true"
    52â†’
    53â†’# Uncomment the following line to enable command auto-correction.
    54â†’# ENABLE_CORRECTION="true"
    55â†’
    56â†’# Uncomment the following line to display red dots whilst waiting for completion.
    57â†’# You can also set it to another string to have that shown instead of the default red dots.
    58â†’# e.g. COMPLETION_WAITING_DOTS="%F{yellow}waiting...%f"
    59â†’# Caution: this setting can cause issues with multiline prompts in zsh < 5.7.1 (see #5765)
    60â†’# COMPLETION_WAITING_DOTS="true"
    61â†’
    62â†’# Uncomment the following line if you want to disable marking untracked files
    63â†’# under VCS as dirty. This makes repository status check for large repositories
    64â†’# much, much faster.
    65â†’# DISABLE_UNTRACKED_FILES_DIRTY="true"
    66â†’
    67â†’# Uncomment the following line if you want to change the command execution time
    68â†’# stamp shown in the history command output.
    69â†’# You can set one of the optional three formats:
    70â†’# "mm/dd/yyyy"|"dd.mm.yyyy"|"yyyy-mm-dd"
    71â†’# or set a custom format using the strftime function format specifications,
    72â†’# see 'man strftime' for details.
    73â†’# HIST_STAMPS="mm/dd/yyyy"
    74â†’
    75â†’# Would you like to use another custom folder than $ZSH/custom?
    76â†’# ZSH_CUSTOM=/path/to/new-custom-folder
    77â†’
    78â†’# Which plugins would you like to load?
    79â†’# Standard plugins can be found in $ZSH/plugins/
    80â†’# Custom plugins may be added to $ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/
    81â†’# Example format: plugins=(rails git textmate ruby lighthouse)
    82â†’# Add wisely, as too many plugins slow down shell startup.
    83â†’plugins=(git)
    84â†’

    86â†’

    92â†’# export LANG=en_US.UTF-8

    95â†’# if [[ -n $SSH_CONNECTION ]]; then
    96â†’#   export EDITOR='vim'
    97â†’# else
    98â†’#   export EDITOR='nvim'
    99â†’# fi
   100â†’
   101â†’# Compilation flags
   102â†’# export ARCHFLAGS="-arch $(uname -m)"
   103â†’
   104â†’# Set personal aliases, overriding those provided by Oh My Zsh libs,
   105â†’# plugins, and themes. Aliases can be placed here, though Oh My Zsh
   106â†’# users are encouraged to define aliases within a top-level file in
   107â†’# the $ZSH_CUSTOM folder, with .zsh extension. Examples:
   108â†’# - $ZSH_CUSTOM/aliases.zsh
   109â†’# - $ZSH_CUSTOM/macos.zsh
   110â†’# For a full list of active aliases, run `alias`.
   111â†’#
   112â†’# Example aliases
   113â†’# alias zshconfig="mate ~/.zshrc"
   114â†’# alias ohmyzsh="mate ~/.oh-my-zsh"
   115â†’
   116â†’# aliases
   117â†’alias resource='source ~/.zshrc'
   118â†’alias vib='vim ~/.zshrc;resource'
   119â†’alias gs='git status'
   120â†’alias python="python3"
   121â†’alias pip="pip3"
   122â†’alias tf="terraform"
   123â†’
   124â†’# functions
   125â†’function acp() {
   126â†’  # Define colors
   127â†’  GREEN='\033[0;32m'
   128â†’  RED='\033[0;31m'
   129â†’  YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
   130â†’  NC='\033[0m' # No Color
   131â†’
   132â†’  # Check if a commit message is provided
   133â†’  if [ -z "$1" ]; then
   134â†’    echo -e "${RED}Error: No commit message provided.${NC}"
   135â†’    read -p "Please enter a commit message: " commit_message
   136â†’    if [ -z "$commit_message" ]; then
   137â†’      echo -e "${RED}Error: Still no commit message. Aborting.${NC}"
   138â†’      return 1
   139â†’    fi
   140â†’  else
   141â†’    commit_message=$1
   142â†’  fi
   143â†’
   144â†’  # Add changes
   145â†’  echo -e "${YELLOW}Adding changes...${NC}"
   146â†’  if ! git add .; then
   147â†’    echo -e "${RED}Failed to add changes. Aborting.${NC}"
   148â†’    return 1
   149â†’  fi
   150â†’
   151â†’  # Commit changes
   152â†’  echo -e "${YELLOW}Committing changes...${NC}"
   153â†’  if ! git commit -m "$commit_message"; then
   154â†’    echo -e "${RED}Failed to commit changes. Aborting.${NC}"
   155â†’    return 1
   156â†’  fi
   157â†’
   158â†’  # Push changes
   159â†’  echo -e "${YELLOW}Pushing changes...${NC}"
   160â†’  if git push; then
   161â†’    echo -e "${GREEN}Changes pushed successfully!${NC}"
   162â†’  else
   163â†’    echo -e "${RED}Failed to push changes. Please check your connection or remote repository settings.${NC}"
   164â†’    return 1
   165â†’  fi
   166â†’}
   167â†’
   168â†’
   169â†’# Function to delete a host from known_hosts file
   170â†’# Add this to your .zshrc file
   171â†’
   172â†’delkh() {
   173â†’    # Check if argument is provided
   174â†’    if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
   175â†’        echo "Usage: delkh <hostname or IP>"
   176â†’        echo "Example: delkh github.com"
   177â†’        echo "Example: delkh 192.168.1.100"
   178â†’        return 1
   179â†’    fi
   180â†’
   181â†’    local HOST="$1"
   182â†’    local KNOWN_HOSTS="$HOME/.ssh/known_hosts"
   183â†’
   184â†’    # Check if known_hosts file exists
   185â†’    if [ ! -f "$KNOWN_HOSTS" ]; then
   186â†’        echo "Error: $KNOWN_HOSTS file not found"
   187â†’        return 1
   188â†’    fi
   189â†’
   190â†’    # Create backup of known_hosts
   191â†’    cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS" "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"
   192â†’
   193â†’    # Count matching lines before deletion
   194â†’    local MATCHES=$(grep -c "$HOST" "$KNOWN_HOSTS" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
   195â†’
   196â†’    if [ "$MATCHES" -eq 0 ]; then
   197â†’        echo "No entries found for: $HOST"
   198â†’        return 0
   199â†’    fi
   200â†’
   201â†’    # Remove the host using ssh-keygen (safer than sed)
   202â†’    ssh-keygen -R "$HOST" 2>/dev/null
   203â†’
   204â†’    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
   205â†’        echo "âœ… Removed entry/entries for: $HOST"
   206â†’        echo "ðŸ“ Backup saved to: $KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"
   207â†’    else
   208â†’        echo "âŒ Failed to remove entries for: $HOST"
   209â†’        # Restore from backup if removal failed
   210â†’        cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup" "$KNOWN_HOSTS"
   211â†’        return 1
   212â†’    fi
   213â†’}
   214â†’
   215â†’# To customize prompt, run `p10k configure` or edit ~/.p10k.zsh.
   216â†’# commented out for now  [[ ! -f ~/.p10k.zsh ]] || source ~/.p10k.zsh
   217â†’eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
   218â†’source "/opt/homebrew/opt/spaceship/spaceship.zsh"
   219â†’source /opt/homebrew/share/zsh-syntax-highlighting/zsh-syntax-highlighting.zsh
   220â†’
   221â†’if [ -z "$SSH_AUTH_SOCK" ]; then
   222â†’    eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
   223â†’    ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
   224â†’fi
   225â†’
   226â†’# Load secure environment variables
   227â†’if [ -f ~/.env ]; then
   228â†’    source ~/.env
   229â†’fi
   230â†’
   231â†’
   232â†’# Docker utility functions
   233â†’docker-reset() {
   234â†’    echo "Stopping all containers..."
   235â†’    docker stop $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
   236â†’    echo "Removing all containers..."
   237â†’    docker rm $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
   238â†’    echo "Removing all images..."
   239â†’    docker rmi $(docker images -q) 2>/dev/null
   240â†’    echo "Pruning system (volumes, networks, build cache)..."
   241â†’    docker system prune -af --volumes
   242â†’    echo "Docker reset complete!"
   243â†’}
   244â†’
   245â†’docker-kill-all() {
   246â†’    echo "Killing all running containers..."
   247â†’    docker kill $(docker ps -q) 2>/dev/null
   248â†’    echo "All running containers killed!"
   249â†’}
   250â†’
   251â†’# Created by `pipx` on 2025-08-01 21:24:35
   252â†’export PATH="$PATH:/Users/davidg/.local/bin"
   253â†’eval "$(fzf --zsh)"
   254â†’

file.content:
# Enable Powerlevel10k instant prompt. Should stay close to the top of ~/.zshrc.
# Initialization code that may require console input (password prompts, [y/n]
# confirmations, etc.) must go above this block; everything else may go below.
if [[ -r "${XDG_CACHE_HOME:-$HOME/.cache}/p10k-instant-prompt-${(%):-%n}.zsh" ]]; then
  source "${XDG_CACHE_HOME:-$HOME/.cache}/p10k-instant-prompt-${(%):-%n}.zsh"
fi

# If you come from bash you might have to change your $PATH.
# export PATH=$HOME/bin:$HOME/.local/bin:/usr/local/bin:$PATH

# Path to your Oh My Zsh installation.
export ZSH="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh"

# Claude Code TTS Configuration
# API keys moved to ~/.env for security

# Set name of the theme to load --- if set to "random", it will
# load a random theme each time Oh My Zsh is loaded, in which case,
# to know which specific one was loaded, run: echo $RANDOM_THEME
# See https://github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/wiki/Themes
ZSH_THEME="robbyrussell"

# Set list of themes to pick from when loading at random
# Setting this variable when ZSH_THEME=random will cause zsh to load
# a theme from this variable instead of looking in $ZSH/themes/
# If set to an empty array, this variable will have no effect.
# ZSH_THEME_RANDOM_CANDIDATES=( "robbyrussell" "agnoster" )

# Uncomment the following line to use case-sensitive completion.
# CASE_SENSITIVE="true"

# Uncomment the following line to use hyphen-insensitive completion.
# Case-sensitive completion must be off. _ and - will be interchangeable.
# HYPHEN_INSENSITIVE="true"

# Uncomment one of the following lines to change the auto-update behavior
# zstyle ':omz:update' mode disabled  # disable automatic updates
# zstyle ':omz:update' mode auto      # update automatically without asking
# zstyle ':omz:update' mode reminder  # just remind me to update when it's time

# Uncomment the following line to change how often to auto-update (in days).
# zstyle ':omz:update' frequency 13

# Uncomment the following line if pasting URLs and other text is messed up.
# DISABLE_MAGIC_FUNCTIONS="true"

# Uncomment the following line to disable colors in ls.
# DISABLE_LS_COLORS="true"

# Uncomment the following line to disable auto-setting terminal title.
# DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true"

# Uncomment the following line to enable command auto-correction.
# ENABLE_CORRECTION="true"

# Uncomment the following line to display red dots whilst waiting for completion.
# You can also set it to another string to have that shown instead of the default red dots.
# e.g. COMPLETION_WAITING_DOTS="%F{yellow}waiting...%f"
# Caution: this setting can cause issues with multiline prompts in zsh < 5.7.1 (see #5765)
# COMPLETION_WAITING_DOTS="true"

# Uncomment the following line if you want to disable marking untracked files
# under VCS as dirty. This makes repository status check for large repositories
# much, much faster.
# DISABLE_UNTRACKED_FILES_DIRTY="true"

# Uncomment the following line if you want to change the command execution time
# stamp shown in the history command output.
# You can set one of the optional three formats:
# "mm/dd/yyyy"|"dd.mm.yyyy"|"yyyy-mm-dd"
# or set a custom format using the strftime function format specifications,
# see 'man strftime' for details.
# HIST_STAMPS="mm/dd/yyyy"

# Would you like to use another custom folder than $ZSH/custom?
# ZSH_CUSTOM=/path/to/new-custom-folder

# Which plugins would you like to load?
# Standard plugins can be found in $ZSH/plugins/
# Custom plugins may be added to $ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/
# Example format: plugins=(rails git textmate ruby lighthouse)
# Add wisely, as too many plugins slow down shell startup.
plugins=(git)

source $ZSH/oh-my-zsh.sh

# User configuration

# export MANPATH="/usr/local/man:$MANPATH"

# You may need to manually set your language environment
# export LANG=en_US.UTF-8

# Preferred editor for local and remote sessions
# if [[ -n $SSH_CONNECTION ]]; then
#   export EDITOR='vim'
# else
#   export EDITOR='nvim'
# fi

# Compilation flags
# export ARCHFLAGS="-arch $(uname -m)"

# Set personal aliases, overriding those provided by Oh My Zsh libs,
# plugins, and themes. Aliases can be placed here, though Oh My Zsh
# users are encouraged to define aliases within a top-level file in
# the $ZSH_CUSTOM folder, with .zsh extension. Examples:
# - $ZSH_CUSTOM/aliases.zsh
# - $ZSH_CUSTOM/macos.zsh
# For a full list of active aliases, run `alias`.
#
# Example aliases
# alias zshconfig="mate ~/.zshrc"
# alias ohmyzsh="mate ~/.oh-my-zsh"

# aliases
alias resource='source ~/.zshrc'
alias vib='vim ~/.zshrc;resource'
alias gs='git status'
alias python="python3"
alias pip="pip3"
alias tf="terraform"

# functions
function acp() {
  # Define colors
  GREEN='\033[0;32m'
  RED='\033[0;31m'
  YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
  NC='\033[0m' # No Color

  # Check if a commit message is provided
  if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo -e "${RED}Error: No commit message provided.${NC}"
    read -p "Please enter a commit message: " commit_message
    if [ -z "$commit_message" ]; then
      echo -e "${RED}Error: Still no commit message. Aborting.${NC}"
      return 1
    fi
  else
    commit_message=$1
  fi

  # Add changes
  echo -e "${YELLOW}Adding changes...${NC}"
  if ! git add .; then
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to add changes. Aborting.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi

  # Commit changes
  echo -e "${YELLOW}Committing changes...${NC}"
  if ! git commit -m "$commit_message"; then
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to commit changes. Aborting.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi

  # Push changes
  echo -e "${YELLOW}Pushing changes...${NC}"
  if git push; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}Changes pushed successfully!${NC}"
  else
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to push changes. Please check your connection or remote repository settings.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi
}


# Function to delete a host from known_hosts file
# Add this to your .zshrc file

delkh() {
    # Check if argument is provided
    if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "Usage: delkh <hostname or IP>"
        echo "Example: delkh github.com"
        echo "Example: delkh 192.168.1.100"
        return 1
    fi

    local HOST="$1"
    local KNOWN_HOSTS="$HOME/.ssh/known_hosts"

    # Check if known_hosts file exists
    if [ ! -f "$KNOWN_HOSTS" ]; then
        echo "Error: $KNOWN_HOSTS file not found"
        return 1
    fi

    # Create backup of known_hosts
    cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS" "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"

    # Count matching lines before deletion
    local MATCHES=$(grep -c "$HOST" "$KNOWN_HOSTS" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

    if [ "$MATCHES" -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "No entries found for: $HOST"
        return 0
    fi

    # Remove the host using ssh-keygen (safer than sed)
    ssh-keygen -R "$HOST" 2>/dev/null

    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "âœ… Removed entry/entries for: $HOST"
        echo "ðŸ“ Backup saved to: $KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"
    else
        echo "âŒ Failed to remove entries for: $HOST"
        # Restore from backup if removal failed
        cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup" "$KNOWN_HOSTS"
        return 1
    fi
}

# To customize prompt, run `p10k configure` or edit ~/.p10k.zsh.
# commented out for now  [[ ! -f ~/.p10k.zsh ]] || source ~/.p10k.zsh
eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
source "/opt/homebrew/opt/spaceship/spaceship.zsh"
source /opt/homebrew/share/zsh-syntax-highlighting/zsh-syntax-highlighting.zsh

if [ -z "$SSH_AUTH_SOCK" ]; then
    eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
    ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
fi

# Load secure environment variables
if [ -f ~/.env ]; then
    source ~/.env
fi


# Docker utility functions
docker-reset() {
    echo "Stopping all containers..."
    docker stop $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Removing all containers..."
    docker rm $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Removing all images..."
    docker rmi $(docker images -q) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Pruning system (volumes, networks, build cache)..."
    docker system prune -af --volumes
    echo "Docker reset complete!"
}

docker-kill-all() {
    echo "Killing all running containers..."
    docker kill $(docker ps -q) 2>/dev/null
    echo "All running containers killed!"
}

# Created by `pipx` on 2025-08-01 21:24:35
export PATH="$PATH:/Users/davidg/.local/bin"
eval "$(fzf --zsh)"

content.text:
I can see the issue - you have multiple conflicting prompt systems:
- Powerlevel10k (commented out)  
- Spaceship theme
- Oh-my-zsh with robbyrussell theme

This creates a messy, slow shell. As a poweruser, I recommend switching to **Starship** - a fast, minimal, cross-shell prompt that's much cleaner than oh-my-zsh.

content.text:
Here's my clean solution:

1. **Remove oh-my-zsh** - It's bloated and slow
2. **Install Starship** - Fast, minimal, customizable
3. **Keep your useful functions** - acp, delkh, docker utilities
4. **Clean up redundant configurations**

  /opt/homebrew/share/zsh/site-functions
==> Auto-updating Homebrew...

HOMEBREW_NO_AUTO_UPDATE. Hide these hints with HOMEBREW_NO_ENV_HINTS (see `man brew`).

Updated 2 taps (homebrew/core and homebrew/cask).
==> New Formulae
bstring: Fork of Paul Hsieh's Better String Library
manifold: Geometry library for topological robustness
pyrefly: Fast type checker and IDE for Python

input.content:
# Clean, minimal zsh configuration
# No more oh-my-zsh bloat!

# Environment setup
eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
export PATH="$PATH:/Users/davidg/.local/bin"

# Starship prompt (fast and minimal)
eval "$(starship init zsh)"

# Essential plugins only
source /opt/homebrew/share/zsh-syntax-highlighting/zsh-syntax-highlighting.zsh

# SSH agent setup
if [ -z "$SSH_AUTH_SOCK" ]; then
    eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
    ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
fi

# FZF fuzzy finder
eval "$(fzf --zsh)"

# Load secure environment variables
if [ -f ~/.env ]; then
    source ~/.env
fi

# Aliases
alias resource='source ~/.zshrc'
alias vib='vim ~/.zshrc;resource'
alias gs='git status'
alias python="python3"
alias pip="pip3"
alias tf="terraform"

# Git add-commit-push function
function acp() {
  GREEN='\033[0;32m'
  RED='\033[0;31m'
  YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
  NC='\033[0m'

  if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo -e "${RED}Error: No commit message provided.${NC}"
    read -p "Please enter a commit message: " commit_message
    if [ -z "$commit_message" ]; then
      echo -e "${RED}Error: Still no commit message. Aborting.${NC}"
      return 1
    fi
  else
    commit_message=$1
  fi

  echo -e "${YELLOW}Adding changes...${NC}"
  if ! git add .; then
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to add changes. Aborting.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi

  echo -e "${YELLOW}Committing changes...${NC}"
  if ! git commit -m "$commit_message"; then
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to commit changes. Aborting.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi

  echo -e "${YELLOW}Pushing changes...${NC}"
  if git push; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}Changes pushed successfully!${NC}"
  else
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to push changes. Please check your connection or remote repository settings.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi
}

# Delete known_hosts entry function
delkh() {
    if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "Usage: delkh <hostname or IP>"
        echo "Example: delkh github.com"
        return 1
    fi

    local HOST="$1"
    local KNOWN_HOSTS="$HOME/.ssh/known_hosts"

    if [ ! -f "$KNOWN_HOSTS" ]; then
        echo "Error: $KNOWN_HOSTS file not found"
        return 1
    fi

    cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS" "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"
    local MATCHES=$(grep -c "$HOST" "$KNOWN_HOSTS" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

    if [ "$MATCHES" -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "No entries found for: $HOST"
        return 0
    fi

    ssh-keygen -R "$HOST" 2>/dev/null

    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "âœ… Removed entry/entries for: $HOST"
        echo "ðŸ“ Backup saved to: $KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"
    else
        echo "âŒ Failed to remove entries for: $HOST"
        cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup" "$KNOWN_HOSTS"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Docker utility functions
docker-reset() {
    echo "Stopping all containers..."
    docker stop $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Removing all containers..."
    docker rm $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Removing all images..."
    docker rmi $(docker images -q) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Pruning system (volumes, networks, build cache)..."
    docker system prune -af --volumes
    echo "Docker reset complete!"
}

docker-kill-all() {
    echo "Killing all running containers..."
    docker kill $(docker ps -q) 2>/dev/null
    echo "All running containers killed!"
}

# Clean, minimal zsh configuration
# No more oh-my-zsh bloat!

# Environment setup
eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
export PATH="$PATH:/Users/davidg/.local/bin"

# Starship prompt (fast and minimal)
eval "$(starship init zsh)"

# Essential plugins only
source /opt/homebrew/share/zsh-syntax-highlighting/zsh-syntax-highlighting.zsh

# SSH agent setup
if [ -z "$SSH_AUTH_SOCK" ]; then
    eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
    ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
fi

# FZF fuzzy finder
eval "$(fzf --zsh)"

# Load secure environment variables
if [ -f ~/.env ]; then
    source ~/.env
fi

# Aliases
alias resource='source ~/.zshrc'
alias vib='vim ~/.zshrc;resource'
alias gs='git status'
alias python="python3"
alias pip="pip3"
alias tf="terraform"

# Git add-commit-push function
function acp() {
  GREEN='\033[0;32m'
  RED='\033[0;31m'
  YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
  NC='\033[0m'

  if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo -e "${RED}Error: No commit message provided.${NC}"
    read -p "Please enter a commit message: " commit_message
    if [ -z "$commit_message" ]; then
      echo -e "${RED}Error: Still no commit message. Aborting.${NC}"
      return 1
    fi
  else
    commit_message=$1
  fi

  echo -e "${YELLOW}Adding changes...${NC}"
  if ! git add .; then
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to add changes. Aborting.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi

  echo -e "${YELLOW}Committing changes...${NC}"
  if ! git commit -m "$commit_message"; then
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to commit changes. Aborting.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi

  echo -e "${YELLOW}Pushing changes...${NC}"
  if git push; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}Changes pushed successfully!${NC}"
  else
    echo -e "${RED}Failed to push changes. Please check your connection or remote repository settings.${NC}"
    return 1
  fi
}

# Delete known_hosts entry function
delkh() {
    if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "Usage: delkh <hostname or IP>"
        echo "Example: delkh github.com"
        return 1
    fi

    local HOST="$1"
    local KNOWN_HOSTS="$HOME/.ssh/known_hosts"

    if [ ! -f "$KNOWN_HOSTS" ]; then
        echo "Error: $KNOWN_HOSTS file not found"
        return 1
    fi

    cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS" "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"
    local MATCHES=$(grep -c "$HOST" "$KNOWN_HOSTS" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

    if [ "$MATCHES" -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "No entries found for: $HOST"
        return 0
    fi

    ssh-keygen -R "$HOST" 2>/dev/null

    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "âœ… Removed entry/entries for: $HOST"
        echo "ðŸ“ Backup saved to: $KNOWN_HOSTS.backup"
    else
        echo "âŒ Failed to remove entries for: $HOST"
        cp "$KNOWN_HOSTS.backup" "$KNOWN_HOSTS"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Docker utility functions
docker-reset() {
    echo "Stopping all containers..."
    docker stop $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Removing all containers..."
    docker rm $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Removing all images..."
    docker rmi $(docker images -q) 2>/dev/null
    echo "Pruning system (volumes, networks, build cache)..."
    docker system prune -af --volumes
    echo "Docker reset complete!"
}

docker-kill-all() {
    echo "Killing all running containers..."
    docker kill $(docker ps -q) 2>/dev/null
    echo "All running containers killed!"
}

input.content:
# Starship configuration - minimal and clean
# Documentation: https://starship.rs/config/

# Prompt format
format = "$directory$git_branch$git_status$character"

# Right prompt
right_format = "$time"

[character]
success_symbol = "[â¯](green)"
error_symbol = "[â¯](red)"

[directory]
truncation_length = 3
style = "cyan"

[git_branch]
format = "[$branch]($style) "
style = "purple"

[git_status]
format = "[$all_status$ahead_behind]($style)"
style = "red"

[time]
disabled = false
format = "[$time]($style)"
style = "bright-black"

# Starship configuration - minimal and clean
# Documentation: https://starship.rs/config/

# Prompt format
format = "$directory$git_branch$git_status$character"

# Right prompt
right_format = "$time"

[character]
success_symbol = "[â¯](green)"
error_symbol = "[â¯](red)"

[directory]
truncation_length = 3
style = "cyan"

[git_branch]
format = "[$branch]($style) "
style = "purple"

[git_status]

style = "red"

[time]
disabled = false
format = "[$time]($style)"
style = "bright-black"

content.text:
Done! Your shell is now clean and fast. Key changes:

**Removed:**
- Oh-my-zsh (bloated framework)
- Spaceship theme (redundant)
- Powerlevel10k references

**Added:**
- **Starship prompt** - Fast, minimal, cross-shell
- Clean configuration with only essentials

**Kept:**
- All your useful functions (`acp`, `delkh`, `docker-*`)
- Essential tools (fzf, syntax highlighting)
- Your aliases

Run `source ~/.zshrc` to apply changes. Your prompt will now be clean with just:
`~/directory [git-branch] â¯`

Starship is much faster than oh-my-zsh and highly customizable via `~/.config/starship.toml`.
